meanings.definition: To argue or dispute angrily or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The siblings wrangled over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors wrangled about the property line for hours.
meanings.sent3: The two friends playfully wrangled over which movie to watch.
meanings.sent4: The politicians wrangled over the new law, each trying to gain the upper hand.
meanings.sent5: The students wrangled over the best way to solve the math problem.

meanings.definition: To round up, herd, or manage livestock.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy wrangled the cattle into the pen before sunset.
meanings.sent2: The farmer wrangled the sheep into the barn for shearing.
meanings.sent3: The rancher wrangled the horses into the stable for the night.
meanings.sent4: The shepherd wrangled the goats back to the pasture after they escaped.
meanings.sent5: The wrangler wrangled the horses for the rodeo show.

meanings.definition: To struggle or wrestle with something.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman wrangled with a big catch on his line.
meanings.sent2: The hiker wrangled with the heavy backpack up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The child wrangled with the jar lid to open it for a snack.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic wrangled with the rusty bolt to loosen it.
meanings.sent5: The gardener wrangled with the stubborn weed to pull it out.
